oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jesse Cox portrait photograph
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Portrait photograph of Primitive Baptist minister and Williamson County resident, Jesse Cox. The subject is seated. The back of the photograph also describes Cox as a historian.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Poole, R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jesse Cox was a pioneer Williamson County resident who made a living as an itinerant Primitive Baptist minister. He would be a survivor of hardship, religious controversies, and the Civil War. Cox supported the Confederacy.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cox, Jesse
Portrait photographs
